subject: Data
title: Treemaps: Seeing Hierarchies at a Glance
description: A micro-lesson that makes Treemaps: Seeing Hierarchies at a Glance usable.

hook.text: A professor needed to see what was eating his hard drive. He invented a chart type to find out.

buildup.text: Ben Shneiderman created treemaps in 1990 â€” nested rectangles where size represents data value.

discovery.text: Treemaps show hierarchical data compactly: the biggest rectangle is the biggest category, instantly.

twist.text: Stock market treemaps became wildly popular â€” showing an entire market's daily performance in one screen.

climax.text: Treemaps turned a technical disk-space problem into one of the most versatile visualization types.

punchline.text: A full-disk problem inspired a universal solution.
